result.title: Capitalize from small to big(vise-versa).
result.content:
There are a lot of problems about capitalize.Today I will say how to capitalize.First we need to know the relation between small hand letters and big hand letters.So we need to understand ASCII code.Every character has it's own ASCII code.To find the ASCII code ,you can visit : http://ee.hawaii.edu/~tep/EE160/Book/chap4/subsection2.1.1.1.html . You can see that small hand letters and big hand letters have different ASCII codes. Relation between 'a' and 'A' ,'b' and 'B' ... 'z' and 'Z' is constant.That is 32.That's if subtract 32 to any small hand letters , it will become big hand letter and vise-versa . Here is a example(for GNU C):
"#include <stdio.h>
"#include <stdlib.h>
"#include <string.h> char n[100];
char o[100];
int main(){
scanf("%s",n); int d = strlen(n);
for(int i=0;i<=(d-1);i++){ o[i] = n[i]-32; printf("%c",o[i]);
}
return 0;
}

Type and small hand letters and get big hand letters!Happy programming!
